question: A person holding a radiotelegraph third class operator permit is authorized to operate:

answers.a: A.Radiotelegraph stations on aircraft with power under 100 watts
answers.b: B.Radiotelephone communication stations on aircraft with power under 250 watts
answers.d: D.Any radiotelephone station on a ship

question: Technical adjustments to a radiotelegraph transmitter at a land station may be made by:

answers.a: A.Any representative of the station licensee
answers.b: B.The holder of a restricted radiotelephone permit
answers.c: C.The holder of a second class radiotelegraph license
answers.d: D.Any holder of a radiotelegraph third class operator permit

question: The radio operator of a manually operated radiotelegraph station is required to:

answers.a: A.Post or have available his operator license or permit
answers.b: B.Take a code examination each time his license or permit is renewed
answers.c: C.Keep the station license in his personal possession at all times
answers.d: D.Sign the radio log at 4hour intervals

question: When an operator license or permit has been sent to the FCC for renewal, duplication, replacement, endorsement, etc., the operator is required to exhibit at his operating place of duty in lieu of the original document:

answers.a: A.A signed copy of the application which has been filed with the FCC
answers.b: B.A letter of authorization from the FCC

question: In transmitting the radiotelegraph Urgency Signal:

answers.a: A.The signal must consist of groups of four
answers.b: B.The signal must consist of groups of five
answers.c: C.The signal should be sent as one character
answers.d: D.The letters of each group should be clearly separated from each other

question: In radiotelegraphy the Distress signal is:
In radiotelegraphy the Safety Signal is:

answers.a: A.The signal should be repeated five times without any break between the groups
answers.b: B.The signals should be repeated six times without any break between the groups
answers.c: C.The dots should be made as long as the dashes
answers.d: D.The signal should be transmitted at maximum power if possible

question: In case of distress, urgency or safety, the speed of radiotelegraph transmission should not in general exceed:

question: A radiotelegram usually consists of:
The preamble to a radiotelegram usually contains the:

question: The service prefix on a radiotelegram is used to indicate the:

answers.d: D.Class of handling or charge rate

question: Word count in a radiotelegram indicates:

answers.b: B.The number of chargeable words in the radiotelegram

answers.d: D.That numbers or odd symbols in the telegram have been collated

question: Confidential radiotelegraph messages are often transmitted by means of:

answers.a: A.All chargeable words in the telegram
answers.b: B.Words or numbers sent in groups of five
answers.c: C.Long words or numbers broken up into two or more words or units
answers.d: D.Words or numbers in the telegram that are restated at the end of the telegram for verification

question: A message requesting or giving information concerning another message is called a:
If a radiotelegraph station receives and transmits messages for the general public:

answers.a: A.The station must be licensed to handle public correspondence
answers.b: B.The chief operator must hold a radiotelegraph first class operator license
answers.c: C.The station must be accessible to the general public
answers.d: D.The station must be a government station

question: Qsignals are used because they:

answers.c: C.May be used in place of assigned call letters

question: If a station reports that your signal has changed from QSA 1 to QSA 5, you would know that:

answers.d: D.Your signals are transmitted too slow

question: If you are standing by because other stations have been carrying on distress traffic and you hear one of them transmitting a general call followed by QUM, you would know that:

answers.a: A.There has been great loss of life and property
answers.b: B.The distress is becoming more severe

question: QRL means:
The proper way for station KABC to call station WDEF is:

answers.b: B.WDEF WDEF K DE KABC KABC K
answers.c: C.WDEF WDEF WDEF DE KABC KABC KABC
answers.d: D.KABC KABC AR WDEF WDEF K

question: The proper way for station WDEF to answer station KABC is:

answers.d: D.KABC KABC KABC DE WDEF WDEF WDEF K

question: Radio operators listening to CW signals for long periods may get relief from hearing fatigue by:

answers.d: D.Changing the tone of the signal

question: The speed of transmission of radiotelegraph signals in routine communications should not exceed:

answers.c: C.The maximum speed that the receiving operator can receive accurately

question: A system of radiotelegraphy in which the receiving operator can press his key and signal the transmitting operator to interrupt his transmission is called:
When receiving CW signals through interference:

answers.a: A.The crystal filter switch should be off
answers.b: B.The crystal filter switch should be on
answers.c: C.The receiver must be adjusted for broad tuning
answers.d: D.The audio volume control must always be set at maximum

question: If a radio receiver blocks on the reception of strong A2 signals:

answers.a: A.The RF gain should be reduced
answers.b: B.The BFO control should be on
answers.d: D.The antenna trimmer should be set for maximum signal

question: When receiving type A2 signals on a receiver:

answers.a: A.The audio volume must be set at maximum
answers.b: B.The crystal phasing switch must be on
answers.c: C.The antenna aligning control must be adjusted for maximum signal
answers.d: D.The BFO is generally turned off

question: In the care of a hand radiotelegraph transmitting key, the operator should occasionally:

answers.a: A.Wash the key with salt and water
answers.b: B.Apply petroleum jelly to the key contacts
answers.c: C.Lubricate the key pivots with linseed oil
answers.d: D.Clean or burnish the key contacts

question: In addition to distress, safety and urgency signals and messages, the International Distress Frequency is normally used for:

As a general rule when sending a Distress Call by radiotelegraphy, the Distress Signal and call sign of the station in distress appear:

answers.a: A.Standard time at any given zone as indicated on clocks with dial marked 0000 to 0600
answers.b: B.Time system used at sea in which time is expressed in bells, as 4 bells, 8 bells, etc.
answers.c: C.Time difference between the Greenwich meridian and the international date line expressed from 0000 to 2400 hours
answers.d: D.Time at the meridian of Greenwich, England, and reckoned from 0000 to 2400 hours beginning at midnight

question: The radio silent period of the maritime service beginning at 15 minutes and 45 minutes past the hour on 500 kilocycles is for the purpose of:

answers.a: A.Each year to each separate land station
answers.b: B.Each six months from the mobile station
answers.c: C.Each month to each separate land station
answers.d: D.Each day to each separate land station

question: When a station in the maritime mobile service is calling CQ and the call is not followed by K, the transmitted message:

answers.a: A.Has priority over all other transmissions
answers.c: C.Must be transmitted only during silent periods
answers.d: D.Is intended for anyone who can intercept it

question: A land station receiving a distress message must immediately take the necessary action to:

answers.a: A.Notify the authorities participating in the operation of rescue facilities
answers.b: B.Ask the steamship port office for permission to retransmit the distress message, if necessary
answers.c: C.Call CQ and give the location of the land station immediately

question: A conventional hand telegraph key is sometimes adjusted for speed by:

answers.a: A.Adjusting the key spring tension and contacts separation
answers.b: B.Adjusting the width of a vibrating arm
answers.c: C.Varying the pressure on the key contacts
answers.d: D.Adding or removing weights on the key arm

question: An eligible person may:

answers.a: A.Hold two unexpired radiotelegraph operator's certificates at the same time
answers.b: B.Hold a second class radiotelegraph operator's certificate and a marine radio operator's permit
answers.c: C.Hold only one class of valid radiotelegraph operator's certificate
answers.d: D.Hold a second class radiotelegraph operator's certificate and a restricted radiotelephone operator's permit

question: What class of station may not be operated by a third class radiotelegraph permit holder?

answers.c: C.Ship station open to public correspondence by telegraphy

question: Who is not authorized to make technical adjustment to a radiotelephone transmitter?

answers.a: A.1st class radiotelephone operator permit holder

question: Who is authorized to make technical adjustments to a radiotelegraph transmitter?

answers.a: A.1st class radiotelegraph operator permit holder
answers.b: B.2nd class radiotelegraph operator permit holder
answers.c: C.3rd class radiotelegraph operator permit holder

question: The operator on duty at a manually operated radiotelegraph station normally posts his license or permit:

answers.a: A.At the place where he is on duty

question: If a radiotelegraph operator makes an error in transmitting message text, he may indicate that an error has been made by sending:

answers.d: D.***<This answer left blank by the FCC>

question: How should fractions be sent in order to avoid confusion?

answers.a: A.A hyphen or dash is always transmitted between a whole number and a fraction
answers.b: B.The numbers should be spelled out
answers.c: C.Numbers involving fractions should never be sent
answers.d: D.Numbers involving fractions normally are not confused

question: What does the radiotelegraph message contain in addition to the preamble?
What is a coded designation that appears as a group of letters in the preamble?

answers.a: A.The number of words that will be charged
answers.b: B.The total number of words in the preamble and text
answers.c: C.The total number of words in the text and signature
answers.d: D.The total number of words in the preamble, text and signature

question: What time does the serial numbering of radio message begin?

answers.b: B.The period of numbering varies in some foreign stations

question: Code or cipher groups are often used in radiotelegraph messages for:
Figures or odd symbles are collected:

answers.a: A.To make certain of their accuracy
answers.b: B.To put them into a more convenient order
answers.c: C.To give a correct word count

question: Figures or odd symbols are ____ to make certain of their accuracy:

answers.b: B.Put into a more convenient order

question: Receiving conditions are bad.  What operating signal would be used to request each word or group twice?
A service message refers to:

answers.b: B.A message sent by the master of the vessel

question: Why are 'Q' signals used in radiotelegraph communications?

answers.a: A.They permit a short transmission time in handling of common phrases
answers.c: C.They are used internationally and overcome language problems

question: In using 'Q' signals to ask a question, you:

answers.a: A.Follow the Q signal with a question mark
answers.b: B.Prefix the Q signal with a question mark
answers.d: D.Assume the receiving operator knows it as a question

question: The 'Q' signal for 'The name of my station is...' is:

The 'Q' signal for 'I am troubled by static...' is?
The 'Q' signal for 'stop sending...' is?

If the signal strength of a radiotelegraph signal is reported on a scale of 1-5, what is the weakest signal?
If you are called by another station, but you are busy with other traffic, what should you do?

answers.b: B.Acknowledge the call and conclude by indicating a number signifying the number of minutes delay
answers.c: C.Acknowledge the call and conclude by a number signifying the order in which the traffic will be answered
answers.d: D.Ask the calling station to call back later

question: If you are called by another station, but you are busy and anticipate a delay in excess of 10 minutes, what should you do?

answers.b: B.Indicate the reason for the delay
answers.c: C.Indicate the reason for the delay and give the number of minutes of delay
answers.d: D.Ask the calling station to call back later

question: The procedure of radiotelegraph transmission in which one station calls another is:

answers.a: A.WCXY WCXY WCXY DE KMEX KMEX KMEX K
answers.c: C.WCXY WCXY WCXY WCXY WCXY WCXY DE KMEX K

question: The procedure of radiotelegraph transmission in which one station answers the call of another is...?

answers.a: A.KMEX KMEX KMEX DE WCXY WCXY WCXY R K
answers.c: C.KMEX KMEX KMEX DE WCXY WCXY WCXY RRR

question: A station that handles paid or toll radio messages for the general public at established rates, is open to:
How should the speed of transmission of radiotelegraph signals be determined?

answers.a: A.In accordance with the desire of the transmitting operator
answers.b: B.In accordance with the desire of the receiving operator

question: What is the result of a long period of listening to CW telegraph signal of continuous tone?

answers.a: A.Increased operator response to weak signals
answers.c: C.A peak in hearing a continuous tone

question: How can an operator relieve hearing fatigue caused by a long period of listening to a CW telegraph signal of constant tone?

answers.a: A.Vary the frequency of the tones with the BFO control
answers.b: B.Vary the volume of the tone
answers.c: C.Vary the frequency of the tone by turning to a harmonic of the actual frequency

question: What is a cause of hearing fatigue?

answers.a: A.A long period of listening to a CW telegraph signal of continuous tone
answers.b: B.A CW telegraph signal with varying tones

question: What is meant by a break in operation at a radiotelegraph station?

answers.a: A.When the key is up, the station is capable of receiving a signal
answers.b: B.Automatic switching between receiving and transmit modes of the station
answers.c: C.Both stations are capable of interrupting each other

question: What kind of operation allows two stations to interrupt each other, informing the sending station immediately when the receiving station has missed a part of the message?
In a receiver designed for both radiotelephone and radiotelegraph reception, how should the AVC control be set for reception of CW radiotelegraph signals?

answers.b: B.Fast AVC can be used to advantage in the reception of radiotelegraph signals
answers.c: C.To it's ON position for slow AVC

question: In communications receivers, the insertion of a crystal filter:

answers.b: B.Minimizes interference from stations operating on nearby frequencies

question: Interference from stations operating on nearby frequencies can be minimized by:

answers.b: B.Tuning the desired frequency very carefully

question: If a radiotelegraph receiver blocks on the reception of strong signals, what correction can be made?

answers.a: A.Reduce the radio frequency gain control
answers.b: B.Increase the radio frequency gain control

question: How would you adjust a radiotelegraph receiver from the transmission of A2 emissions?

answers.a: A.Turn off the BFO and adjust the receiver from the reception of the tone-modulated signal

question: If a radiotelegraph transmitting station can be heard at more than one place on the tuning dial of the receiver:

answers.a: A.The station is transmitting on more than one frequency
answers.b: B.The station is transmitting on odd harmonics
answers.c: C.The receiver is being tuned to an image frequency

question: Sometimes a radiotelegraph transmitting station can be heard at more than one place on the tuning dial of the receiver.  What does this indicate?

answers.a: A.It is always an indication that the station is transmitting on more than one frequency
answers.b: B.That the receiver is being tuned to an image frequency
answers.c: C.The image frequency signal will be weaker than the signal level received when the receiver is set to the proper frequency of the transmitting station

question: What is an indicator that the receiver is being tuned to an image frequency?

answers.a: A.Hearing a given radiotelegraph transmitting station at more than one place on the tuning dial of the receiver
answers.b: B.The image frequency signal will be weaker than the signal level received when the receiver is set to the proper frequency of the transmitting station
answers.c: C.The station is transmitting on more than one frequency

question: The contact opening of a radiotelegraph transmitting relay should be usually adjusted for about:
The contact opening of a manual radiotelegraph transmitting relay should be:

answers.a: A.Always the same for slow as it is for high speed

question: Side adjustments of a manual radiotelegraph transmitting relay:

answers.b: B.Permit free vertical movement of the arm

question: Proper alignment and free vertical movement of the arm of a manual radiotelegraph transmitting relay are accomplished by:
To adjust a manual radiotelegraph transmitting relay for high speed:

answers.c: C.Adjust the spring tension to the individual's comfort requirements

question: With a 'bug':

answers.b: B.The dot speed is set by weights on the arm of the 'bug'
answers.c: C.Dot-contact speed of usually about 1/8 inch is used

question: Spring tension of a properly adjusted 'bug':

answers.a: A.Is such that 12 to 30 clear dots are sent continuously when the dot lever is held on the keying position
answers.b: B.Is such that 20 or more clear dots are sent continuously when the dot lever is held on the keying position
answers.c: C.Is such that 10 or more clear dots are sent continuously when the dot lever is held on the keying position
answers.d: D.Has nothing to do with the dots

question: With a 'bug':

answers.b: B.The dash speed is set by weights on the arm of the 'bug'
answers.c: C.Contact spacing of the dash arm is set between 1/32 and 1/16 inch

question: An automatic key or 'bug' should be properly adjusted to send good readable radiotelegraph signals.  The dash arm should be adjusted for:
The bearing supporting the vertical shaft on which the dot-dash levers are suspended on an automatic key (or bug) should be adjusted up or down until the movable dot contact on the vibrator arm:

answers.a: A.Makes accurate full-face contact with the stationary dot contact on the post
answers.b: B.Makes partial contact with the stationary dot contact on the post
answers.c: C.Makes no contact with the stationary dot contact on the post

question: The bearing adjustment screws of an automatic key (or bug) should be set:

answers.a: A.So that lateral motion of the dot and dash levers are free
answers.b: B.So that there is no end play of the levers

question: The movable dash contact on the dash lever of an automatic key (or bug) should be adjusted:

answers.a: A.So that it makes full-face contact with the stationary dash contact on the post
answers.b: B.So that it makes partial contact with the stationary dash contact on the post
answers.c: C.So that it makes no contact with the stationary dash contact on the post

question: The movable dash contact on the dash lever should be adjusted so that it makes full-face contact with the stationary dash contact on the post.  It should then:

answers.a: A.Be locked primarily in that position
answers.b: B.Not be locked in that position

question: The spacing of the stationary dash contact of an automatic key (or bug) should:

answers.a: A.Be adjusted to about 1/16 to 1/32 of an inch
answers.b: B.Be adjusted to suit the sending style of the operator

question: The adjustment of the dot lever travel should be:
In an automatic key (or bug), spacing of the stationary dot contact ___ so that when the dot lever is pressed and held over should be adjusted:

answers.a: A.So the instrument will make 12 to 30 clear dots
answers.b: B.So that more that 30 clear dots will be made
answers.c: C.So that less that 5 clear dots will be made

question: The dot speed adjustment weight of an automatic key (or bug) should be set:

answers.a: A.So that the instrument makes dots at a speed proportioned to the speed at which the operator normally makes dashes
answers.b: B.So that about 3 dots are made in the same time the operator makes one dash
answers.c: C.So that for practical operating speeds from 20 to 40 wpm, there will be a dot speed of from 8 to 16 dots per second

question: The dot speed adjustment weight of an automatic key (or bug) should be set:

answers.a: A.So that the practical operating speeds from 20 to 40 wpm, there will be a dot speed of from 8 to 16 dots per second
answers.b: B.So that for practical operating speeds from 10 to 20 wpm, there will be a dot speed of from 16 to 30 dots per second
answers.c: C.So that for practical operating speed of 16 wpm, there will be a dot speed of 16 dots per second

question: Sometimes misalignment of a receiver will cause an unwanted signal to get through to the first detector causing an intermediate frequency signal which passes through the receiver normally.  Such a signal is called:
To obtain maximum response to weak signals in a super-heterodyne receiver:

answers.a: A.R-F gain control should be fully advanced
answers.b: B.BFO control varied for the clearest tone

question: How should a superheterodyne receiver be adjusted for a maximum response to strong CW signals?

answers.a: A.Automatic volume control may be left on
answers.b: B.R-F gain control should be somewhat reduced
answers.c: C.The BFO should be varied for the desired output frequency

question: A system whereby the receiving operator may interrupt the transmitting operator at any point is:

answers.b: B.Accomplished with a relay which changes the antenna from receiving to transmitting

question: A station which handles toll messages is a station:

answers.b: B.That carries non-public communication for business

What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is the readability of my signals?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I increase power?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I decrease power?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I send faster?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Are you ready for automatic operation?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I send more slowly?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Have you anything for me?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Are you ready?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I inform ____ that you are calling him on ____ kHz?' (or MHz)
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'When will you call me again?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is the strength of my signals?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Are my signals fading?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask ' Are you a cargo vessel?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Is my keying defective ?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is the charge to be collected per word to ____ including your internal telegraph charge?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Can you hear me between your signals?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Can you acknowledge receipt?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I repeat the last telegram which I sent you, or some previous telegram?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Did you hear me [or...{call sign}] on ____ kHz {MHz}?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Can you communicate with ____ direct or by relay?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you relay to ____ free of charge?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Have you a doctor on board {or ... Is (name of person) on board}?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I send or reply on this frequency {or on ___ kHz (or MHz)} with emissions of class ___?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you send on this frequency {or ___ kHz (or MHz)} with emissions of class ___?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you listen to ___ {call sign(s)} on ___ kHz (or MHz)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I change to transmission on another frequency?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I send each word or group more than once?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I cancel telegram number ____ as if it had not been sent?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Do you agree with my counting of words?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'How many telegrams have you to send?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is my true bearing from you?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you give me the position of my station according to the bearings taken by the direction-finding stations which you control?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you send two dashes of 10 seconds each followed by your call sign (repeat ___ times) {on ___ kHz (or MHz)}?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is your position in latitude and longitude (or according to any other indications)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is your true track?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is your speed?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is the speed of your aircraft in relation to the surface of the earth?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is your true heading?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'At what time did you depart from ____ (place)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Have you left dock (or port)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Are you going to enter dock (or port)'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Can you communicate with my station by means of the International Code of Signals?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is the correct time?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you send your call sign for ___ minutes...so that your frequency may be measured?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What are the hours during which your station is open?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I stand guard for you on the frequency of ____ kHz (or MHz) from ____ to ____ hours?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you keep your station open for further communication with me until further notice?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Have you news of ____ (call sign)?'

What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Can you give me,in the following order, information concerning: visibility, length of clouds, direction and velocity of ground wind at ____ (place of observation)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is the number of the last message you received from me?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Have you received the urgency signal sent by ____ (call sign)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Have you received a distress signal sent by ____ (call sign)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you be forced to land?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you give me the present barometer pressure at sea level?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Are your navigation lights working?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you indicate the true course for me to steer toward you with no wind?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Can you tell me the condition of the sea observed at ____ (please)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Can you tell me the swell observed at ____ (please)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will vessels in my immediate vicinity please indicate their position, true course and speed?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I search for (1. Aircraft; 2. Ship; 3. a survival craft;) in the vicinity of ____ latitude ____ longitude?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you indicate your position by (1. Searchlights; 2. Black smoke trail; 3. Pyrotechnic lights)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I train my searchlights nearby vertical on a cloud... deflect the beam up wind and on the water to facilitate your landing?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Have survivors (1. received survival equipment; 2. been picked up by rescue vessel; 3. been reached by ground rescue party)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Have you sighted survivors or wreckage?  If so, in what position?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Is position of incident marked?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Shall I Home ship or aircraft to my position?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is my magnetic bearing from you?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'Will you indicate the magnetic course for me to steer towards you with no wind?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is my true bearing from ____ (call sign)?'
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'What is the true bearing of ____ (call sign) from ____ (call sign)?'
What Q-signal would be used to say 'The name of my station is ____'?
What Q-signal would be used to say 'I am busy.  Please do not interfere'?
What Q-signal would be used to say 'Increase power'?
What Q-signal would be used to say 'Your keying is defective'?
What Q-signal would be used to ask 'I have been unable to break in on your transmission'?
